slides.title: India Geography
slides.content:
**28 States, 8 UTs** | Capital: New Delhi
**Neighbors:** Pakistan, China, Nepal, Bhutan, Bangladesh, Myanmar
**Rivers:** Ganga, Yamuna, Brahmaputra, Godavari
**Mountains:** Himalayas (highest), Western/Eastern Ghats

slides.title: World Geography
slides.content:
**Continents:** Asia, Africa, N.America, S.America, Europe, Australia, Antarctica
**Oceans:** Pacific (largest), Atlantic, Indian, Arctic, Southern
**Capitals:** USA-Washington DC, UK-London, China-Beijing, Russia-Moscow

question.questionText: Which is the longest river in India?
question.explanation: Ganga (2,525 km) is India's longest river, flowing from Gangotri Glacier to Bay of Bengal.
